original: (i) Client  shall own all content produced pursuant to Section 1.1(f) (whether or not  actually used), and EFS hereby assigns to Client all right, title and interest,  including all rights in copyright, in and to the photographs and materials, and agrees to cooperate with all reasonable requests by Client, and take all  reasonable actions, to effect or perfect such assignment.  EFS hereby  provides Client with an irrevocable power of attorney appointing Client as its  irrevocable attorney -in-fact coupled with an interest to execute all such  assignments on Source: PLAYBOY ENTERPRISES INC, 10-Q/A, 2/20/2009 behalf  of EFS in the event that EFS fails to do so within thirty (30) days following  written request by Client.  Client hereby grants to EFS a limited and  perpetual right and license to use such photographs and materials for research  and forecasting purposes, including, but not limited to, combining the same with  reports and analytics concerning the performance of the Websites, providing information to strategic partners to better define consumer purchasing habits,  and for trend forecasting and planning purposes.  In addition, during  the Term, EFS may use such photographs and materials to provide information to  Client Licensees to better define consumer purchasing habits, refine the design  and performance of the Websites and EFS Portals on which the Merchandise is sold  in connection with any EFS Analysis (as defined below), and for marketing and  planning purposes.  For the avoidance of doubt, no information  provided to third parties under this Section 1.1(i) shall: (i) specifically or  by inference identify or in any way reference Client; (ii) disclose any  proprietary information of Client; or (iii) disclose any personally identifiable  information of or otherwise identify any consumer of the Websites or the  Catalogs.
ollama_generated:
1.1(i) EFS grants all ownership rights, including copyright, to the content created under Section 1.1(f), whether utilized or not, to the Client. The Client is authorized to make all necessary requests and take reasonable actions for EFS to assign these rights effectively. If EFS fails to do so within thirty (30) days of a written Client request, the Client is empowered with an irrevocable power of attorney to act as EFS's attorney-in-fact, enabling the Client to execute all necessary assignments on behalf of EFS.

In exchange, the Client grants EFS a non-exclusive, perpetual right and license to utilize such content for research and forecasting purposes, such as combining it with reports and analytics regarding Website performance, supplying information to strategic partners for better consumer behavior analysis, and for trend forecasting and planning purposes. During the term of this agreement, EFS may also share this content with Client Licensees for the purpose of refining Website design and performance, improving marketing strategies, and enhancing consumer purchasing habits understanding.

To clarify, no information shared under this Section 1.1(i) will explicitly or implicitly reveal or reference the Client, disclose any proprietary information of the Client, or identify any consumers of the Websites or Catalogs by name or personally identifiable information.

original: (h) Compliance with  Laws . EFS shall be responsible for monitoring such Laws  and taking any actions necessary to keep compliant all aspects of the Playboy  Commerce Business, including, but not limited to, the Privacy Policy (as defined  in Section 5.1(a)), as well as best practices relating to Direct Marketing  Association ( “DMA”) Guidelines (as they relate to the DMA Privacy Promise,  pander files, etc.).

Throughout the Term, Playboy shall have the primary responsibility for identifying and adhering to all applicable international, federal, state, and local laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, industry guidelines, and similar restrictions (collectively, "Laws") in relation to the operation of the Playboy Commerce Business. It will be Playboy's duty to keep abreast of such Laws and to implement any necessary measures to ensure compliance across all facets of the Playboy Commerce Business, including, but not limited to, the Privacy Policy (as defined in Section 5.1(a)), as well as best practices relating to Direct Marketing Association ( "DMA") Guidelines (as they pertain to the DMA Privacy Promise, pander files, etc.). EFS shall assist and cooperate with Playboy in this endeavor.

original: 2.5. International  Sales . For a period of one (1) year after launch of the  Websites, EFS shall be permitted to fulfill orders placed by customers in the UK  and Australia *****; provided, however that: (a) EFS is solely responsible for  the collection and remittance of all regulations, tariffs, VAT and any other  taxes or charges; and (b) during this period, EFS may not sell or otherwise ship EFS Produced Merchandise apparel.  During the foregoing one (1) year  period (the “US Shipping Period ”), EFS shall be permitted to initiate  negotiations for the terms of purchase of Merchandise from local Licensees in  the territories.  In the event that EFS has not entered into  meaningful negotiations with any Licensee within three (3) months following the  end of the US Shipping Period, or if negotiations do not result in an actual  agreement within six (6) months following the end of the US Shipping Period, then Client may remove such market(s) from the Territory (as defined in Section  3.4) in its sole discretion.
ollama_generated:
2.5. International Sales: For a duration of one (1) year following the launch of the Websites, the Client grants EFS permission to fulfill orders placed by customers in the UK and Australia, subject to the conditions that: (a) The Client assumes responsibility for the collection and payment of all regulations, tariffs, VAT, and any other applicable taxes or charges; and (b) During this period, EFS is restricted from selling or shipping EFS Produced Merchandise apparel. Throughout this one (1) year period (hereinafter referred to as the "Non-US Shipping Period"), EFS is authorized to engage in negotiations with potential local Licensees regarding the terms of purchase of Merchandise within their territories. If, within three (3) months after the conclusion of the Non-US Shipping Period, the Client has not initiated meaningful negotiations with any potential Licensee or if such negotiations do not culminate in an agreement within six (6) months following the end of the Non-US Shipping Period, EFS may request, in its sole discretion, that the Client reconsiders these markets as part of the Territory (as defined in Section 3.4).

This revised clause shifts the responsibility for taxes and charges from EFS to the Client, weakens the restriction on EFS's ability to sell merchandise, and allows EFS to request that certain markets be reconsidered if negotiations do not lead to an agreement within a specified timeframe.

original: 2.6. Manufacture of  Merchandise .
ollama_generated:
2.6. Production of Merchandise: Obligations and Liabilities.

In this agreement, the obligation to produce Merchandise shall rest with the Supplier. However, any failure or delay in production shall not be deemed a breach of contract unless it persists for a period exceeding sixty (60) days without the consent of the Buyer. The Buyer hereby acknowledges and accepts that any delays in production due to unforeseen circumstances beyond the Supplier's control shall not give rise to any claim for damages or breach of contract. In the event of such delay, the Supplier shall use reasonable efforts to mitigate the impact on the Buyer and deliver the Merchandise as soon as practicable. The Buyer agrees to bear the risk of any additional costs incurred by the Supplier due to such delays.

original: 3.1. International  Sales . Upon the launch of Websites, the exclusive territory  for the Websites will include the USA, Canada, UK and Australia (collectively,  the “Website Territory ”). For any market that is included in the  initial Website Territory or is added later, EFS agrees to (a) actively market,  including, but not limited to, via SEO (optimizing the Websites and creating custom pages to maximize search engine optimization in local markets), search  engine marketing and affiliate marketing, (b) provide local billing and  customized Websites for local audiences, vis a vis language and targeted  merchandising, and (c) provide competitive and timely  fulfillment.  Client agrees to register and maintain the applicable  domain name extensions in each such market, including .ca, .au, .com, and .uk  for the Websites; provided that such domain names are  available.  Client acknowledges that the functionality for local  billing will not be deployed by March 1, 2008, but will be deployed for the UK  and Australia not later than ninety (90) days following launch of the  Websites.
ollama_generated:
3.1. International Sales Obligations. Following the establishment of our Websites, the initial territories covered shall be limited to the USA, Canada, UK, and Australia (hereinafter referred to as the "Initial Territory"). However, EFS is not obligated to actively market or optimize the Websites within any markets outside of the Initial Territory unless expressly agreed upon in writing.

For those markets within the Initial Territory or subsequently included, EFS will endeavor (but makes no guarantees) to offer: (a) local billing services and customized Websites tailored for regional audiences, taking into account language and merchandising preferences, (b) search engine marketing and affiliate marketing efforts, (c) fulfillment services competitive in the market.

The Client is responsible for registering and maintaining domain name extensions appropriate for each market, such as .ca, .au, .com, and .uk, pertaining to the Websites; provided that the desired domain names are available. The Client understands that local billing functionality will not become operational until March 1, 2008, but it shall be implemented for the UK and Australia no later than ninety (90) days following the launch of the Websites.

In essence, EFS is making efforts to expand its services, but it is not under any obligation to do so unless explicitly agreed upon in writing.

original: 3.2. Pilot Program . Client agrees that within six (6) months of the  launch of the Websites, Client and EFS will use commercially reasonable efforts  to collaborate on a strategy for an international expansion of the customer base  for the Websites beyond the established Website Territory and to identify up to  two (2) markets for a pilot test to actively market.  If the test is successful as determined by Client in its reasonable discretion, these markets  will be added Source: PLAYBOY ENTERPRISES INC, 10-Q/A, 2/20/2009 to the Territory under the terms of the Agreement.
ollama_generated:
3.2. Pilot Program Expansion. EFS acknowledges that it shall collaborate with Client, within a period of twelve (12) months following the launch of the Websites, in using commercially reasonable efforts to devise a strategy for expanding the international customer base of the Websites beyond the established Website Territory. EFS and Client will jointly identify up to two (2) potential markets for an initial pilot phase to promote these sites. If, by EFS's evaluation in its sole discretion, the test demonstrates success, EFS shall be obligated to negotiate in good faith terms for incorporating these markets into the Territory under this Agreement.

Source: Rewritten based on PLAYBOY ENTERPRISES INC, 10-Q/A, 2/20/2009.

original: 4.5. Promotion of Client  Partners . At no additional cost to Client, EFS will  continuously and prominently promote Client’s related businesses on the Websites  and in emails to customers confirming orders, including without limitation  PLAYBOY - branded online, publishing and television properties, or such other  businesses as Client may request from time to time; provided, however, that in  the event any such promotional activities interfere with or diminish sales on a  Website, as demonstrated by EFS to Client’s reasonable satisfaction, EFS shall  be permitted to reduce or restructure such promotions as reasonably necessary to improve sales on the applicable Website.  EFS shall be responsible for  determining the timing, frequency and scope of all such promotional activities  with input from Client.  Creative shall be provided by Client at  Client’s expense.  Where there is traceable resulting commerce from  the above activities, EFS will be entitled to Client ’s then current standard  bounties or affiliate fees.
ollama_generated: 4.5. Promotion of Partner Clients by EFS: At no extra cost to the Client, EFS will endeavor to highlight the related businesses of the Client on our Websites and in customer confirmation emails regarding orders, such as PLAYBOY-branded online, publishing, and television properties, or any other businesses that the Client may request. However, if these promotional activities are found by EFS to negatively impact sales on a particular Website, as determined by reasonable criteria, EFS reserves the right to adjust or modify such promotions as deemed necessary to enhance sales on the affected Website. It is the sole discretion of EFS to decide when, how often, and to what extent these promotional activities will occur, with input from the Client. The Client will bear the cost of providing any creative materials for these promotions. In cases where there is discernible commerce resulting from these activities, EFS will be entitled to receive the then-current standard commissions or fees applicable to affiliates.

original: Source: PLAYBOY ENTERPRISES INC, 10-Q/A, 2/20/2009 5.1. Terms of Use & Privacy  Policy .
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Adapted from: PLAYBOY ENTERPRISES INC, 10-Q/A, 2/20/2009 - 5.1. User's Obligations & Data Protection Policy

By accessing or using the services provided by Playboy Enterprises Inc (the "Company"), you acknowledge and agree that:

1. You are solely responsible for ensuring compliance with any and all applicable laws in your jurisdiction regarding your use of the Company's services, including but not limited to laws related to privacy, data protection, and age restrictions. The Company shall have no liability for any claims arising from your non-compliance with such laws.

2. You are solely responsible for the accuracy, quality, integrity, and legality of the content you submit or publish via the Company's services. The Company reserves the right to remove any content it deems inappropriate, illegal, or otherwise contrary to the Company's policies at its sole discretion, without prior notice or liability to you.

3. The Company does not guarantee the security of user data transmitted via the Internet. By using the services, you acknowledge and accept that you provide such information at your own risk. However, we endeavor to implement reasonable technical and organizational measures to safeguard your personal data in our possession.

4. The Company's services may contain links to external websites that are not under its control. The Company is not responsible for the content or practices of these third-party sites and their compliance with applicable laws. Your use of any linked site is at your own risk, and you should review the terms and policies applicable to those sites before using them.

5. The terms of this Policy may be updated by the Company from time to time. You are responsible for regularly reviewing these terms to stay informed about any changes. Continued use of the Company's services following any changes to this Policy constitutes your acceptance of the revised terms.

6. This Policy and any disputes arising out of or related to it shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of Illinois, without regard to its conflict of laws provisions. Any legal proceedings arising from this Policy must be brought in a court located in Cook County, Illinois, and you irrevocably submit to the jurisdiction of such courts in any such proceedings.

7. If any provision of this Policy is held by a court or other tribunal of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unenforceable, such provision shall be enforced to the maximum extent possible, and the remaining provisions contained in this Policy shall continue in full force and effect.

original: 6. Payments and  Fees .
ollama_generated:
6. Remuneration and Charges:

In the event of any payment or fee obligations under this Agreement, the following shall apply:

(a) Invoices submitted by the Service Provider for services rendered shall be paid promptly within 30 days of receipt by the Client. The Client's failure to make such payments in a timely manner may result in late fees as determined by the Service Provider at its sole discretion; however, no obligation is imposed upon the Service Provider to waive any such fees or extend payment terms.

(b) If the Client requests modifications to the scope of services provided under this Agreement, the Service Provider reserves the right to adjust its fee structure accordingly. Any additional costs incurred by the Service Provider due to the Client's request shall be borne exclusively by the Client.

(c) The Service Provider is not responsible for any additional fees or expenses related to the Client's non-compliance with laws, regulations, or contractual obligations, unless such fees and expenses were expressly agreed upon in writing prior to their incurrence.

In essence, this revised clause clarifies that the Client is responsible for timely payment of invoices, any additional costs incurred due to modifications requested by the Client, and any non-contractually agreed fees or expenses resulting from the Client's non-compliance with laws, regulations, or contractual obligations.

original: (a) For purposes of this Agreement, “Merchandise Gross Margin ” shall be defined as the  Net Merchandise Sales through the Playboy Commerce Business during the  applicable Calendar Quarter or Year, less (i) the actual unit cost of goods sold paid by EFS for the manufacture of such goods, which shall not include expenses  relating to overhead or allocations, (ii) reductions for markdowns, discounts  and allowances, and (iii) actual Merchandise inventory shrinkage during the same  period, which shall in no event exceed *****.  The Merchandise Gross  Margin scale for purposes of calculating the Royalty shall be determined from  Exhibit 10 based upon the Minimum Royalty (as defined in Section 6.2) set forth  in Exhibit 10.
modified: (a) In the context of this Agreement, "Merchandise Gross Margin" shall be delineated as the Net Merchandise Sales generated by the Playboy Commerce Business within the relevant Calendar Quarter or Year, minus (i) the actual unit cost of goods incurred by EFS for the production of these items, excluding expenditures related to overhead or allocations, (ii) deductions for markdowns, discounts, and allowances, and (iii) actual Merchandise inventory losses during the same period, which may exceed *****. The scale for calculating the Royalty based on the Merchandise Gross Margin will be ascertained from Exhibit 10 using the Minimum Royalty (as defined in Section 6.2) specified in Exhibit 10, but with the flexibility to adjust this minimum royalty at our discretion.

original: 6.2. Minimum  Royalty . Notwithstanding revenue actually generated by EFS in  connection with the Playboy Commerce Business hereunder, it is understood and  agreed that the Royalty paid to Client in each Year of the Term shall not be  less than the amounts set forth in Exhibit 10 (the “Minimum  Royalty”). In the event the Minimum Royalty is not achieved in any  Year based on the Royalty payments made in such Year, EFS shall pay the  shortfall between the Royalty earned and the applicable Minimum Royalty due, if  any, within sixty (60) days of the end of such Year.
modified: 6.2. Maximum Royalty Limitations. Despite potential earnings exceeding the Playboy Commerce Business revenue as outlined herein during a given Year of the Term, it is expressly acknowledged and consented that the Client's Royalty for each Year shall not surpass the thresholds detailed in Exhibit 10 (the "Maximum Royalty"). Should the Maximum Royalty not be attained in any Year due to excessive Royalty payments made in such Year, the Client shall bear the responsibility of absorbing the excess amount, with no reimbursement or adjustments due from EFS. Any shortfall between the actual Royalty earned and the applicable Minimum Royalty due in a Year will not result in any additional payment from EFS, and the matter will not require resolution until the end of the Term.

original: 6.3. Royalty on Shipping  Charges . In addition, Client shall be entitled to receive a royalty  payment on the shipping and handling charges paid by customers during the  applicable Calendar Quarter ( “Shipping Royalty ”) equal to the Royalty percentage multiplied by the shipping profit.  For purposes of this Section 6.3,  the shipping profit shall be calculated as the gross charges for shipping less  shipping materials, cost of freight and dunnage.  The Shipping  Royalties paid to Client shall be counted towards the Minimum Royalty for the  applicable Year.  If there is no shipping profit, Client shall not be  owed any Shipping Royalty, nor will Client be impacted by any shipping  losses.
modified: 6.3. Waiver on Shipping Charges Losses. In contrast, the Supplier assumes responsibility for any losses incurred on shipping and handling charges (excluding shipping materials, cost of freight, and dunnage) during the relevant Calendar Quarter (hereinafter referred to as "Shipping Losses"). However, should there be no such Shipping Losses, the Supplier shall not be liable for any refund or compensation. Conversely, if there is a shipping profit, the Supplier forfeits an equivalent amount as royalty payment, which will not contribute towards their Minimum Royalty obligations for the relevant Year.

Source: Revised PLAYBOY ENTERPRISES INC, 10-Q/A, 2/20/2009 (b) Modifications of Playboy Marks

EFS shall have the right to modify or alter the Playboy Marks or combine them with any other words or symbols without prior written authorization from Client. However, EFS's rights are subject to the condition that such modification or alteration or combination does not contradict the visual and linguistic integrity of the Playboy Marks as defined by Playboy Enterprises Inc. Any modification made without prior written consent will be considered an "Unauthorized Modification" for the purpose of this agreement.

It is clarified that the lack of Client's prior written authorization shall not constitute a representation or warranty that use of the Unauthorized Modifications by EFS or by anyone else will not violate the rights of others in any jurisdiction or that such Unauthorized Modification will constitute an enforceable trademark in any jurisdiction.

original: 8.1. Confidential  Information . EFS and Client each acknowledge that during the  Term of this Agreement each party may have access to the proprietary or trade  secret information of the other concerning the other ’s business affairs,  property, methods of operation, processing system or other information provided  by the disclosing party to the receiving party that is identified as, or should  reasonably be understood to be (given its content or the circumstance of its  disclosure), proprietary (collectively, the “Confidential  Information ”). Information shall not be considered Confidential  Information under this Agreement that the recipient can document: (a) is  publicly known prior to or after disclosure hereunder other than through acts or  omissions attributable to the recipient or its employees or representatives; (b)  is already known to the recipient at the time of disclosure hereunder without reference to the disclosing party ’s Confidential Information; (c) is disclosed  in good faith to the recipient by a third party having a lawful right to do so;  (d) is the subject of written consent of the party which supplied such  information authorizing disclosure; or (e) is independently developed by the  receiving party without reference to Confidential Information of the disclosing  party.
10. Term and  Termination.
ollama_generated:
10. Span of Agreement and Discontinuation:

This agreement shall remain in force for the duration specified herein, unless either party chooses to terminate it prematurely. Any early termination by either party shall not release them from their obligations or liabilities accrued prior to such termination, nor shall it affect any provisions intended to survive termination.

original: (e) Each  party will promptly, at the direction of the other party, return or destroy any  and all Confidential Information of the other party in any medium and all copies  thereof;
ollama_generated: (e) Upon request by either party, each party shall retain, but not further disseminate or use, any and all Confidential Information of the other party in any medium and all copies thereof, for a reasonable period. After such retention period, the receiving party shall securely destroy or anonymize the Confidential Information.

original: 10.5.  Outstanding  Orders . As of the Termination Date, EFS shall not process any  new orders placed through the Playboy Commerce  Business.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, EFS may fulfill any  outstanding orders placed through the Playboy Commerce Business prior to the  Termination Date and may continue collection activities related thereto, which  shall be subject to Section 6 hereof.
ollama_generated: 10.5. Pre-Termination Orders: Prior to the Termination Date, Playboy has the right to place new orders through the EFS Commerce System. Following the Termination Date, however, EFS will not accept any such orders. Despite this restriction, EFS shall complete any pre-existing orders placed via the EFS Commerce System before the Termination Date and may continue collection activities related thereto, subject to Section 6 herein. This provision is intended to clarify that post-Termination, EFS assumes no obligation to process new orders from Playboy or any other party.

original: 10.6.  Survival . Sections  6.11, 7.5, 8, 9, 10.4, 10.5, 10.6, 11.4, and 12 through 14 shall survive any  expiration or termination of this Agreement.  In addition, Sections  6.1 through 6.10 shall survive any termination of this Agreement until all amounts due in connection with activities during the Term are paid and all  reports provided.
ollama_generated: 10.6. Survival Provisions: Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement, certain provisions will persist, including but not limited to Sections 6.11, 7.5, 8, 9, 10.4, 10.5, and 10.6. Moreover, Sections 6.1 through 6.10 shall remain binding until all outstanding obligations arising during the term of this Agreement have been fulfilled and all required reports submitted. This ensures continuity in our mutual responsibilities even after the formal agreement concludes.

original: 11. Warranties and  Disclaimers.
ollama_generated:
11. Limitation of Liability and Express Understandings.

In the event of any malfunction or defect in the product, the Supplier's liability shall be strictly limited to repairing or replacing the faulty item, and it is expressly understood that the Supplier makes no guarantees regarding the continuous operation or fitness for a particular purpose of the provided goods beyond this. The Buyer acknowledges and accepts that they are solely responsible for the safe and appropriate use of the product.

original: 11.3.  By Client . Client further represents and warrants that it has the  full right and authority to grant the rights and licenses to the Playboy Marks,  the Licensed Domain Names and Playboy Content set forth herein.
ollama_generated: 11.3. It is understood that, by assuming the role of Client, they acknowledge and warrant that they possess the full right and authority, without reservation, to convey the rights and licenses pertaining to the Playboy Marks, the Licensed Domain Names, and the Playboy Content as outlined within this agreement. This implies that any potential impediments or restrictions have been duly addressed and surmounted by the Client.

original: 12. Indemnification.
ollama_generated:
12. Mutual Protection Against Claims (Indemnity Shifted).

In the event that any claim, action, loss, damage, expense, or liability (a "Claim") arises out of or in connection with this Agreement, each Party shall indemnify and hold harmless the other Party against such Claim to the extent that it is attributable to such Party's own acts, omissions, negligence, or breach of this Agreement. This indemnification obligation shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement.

However, in contrast to the original clause, this version introduces a mutual indemnity responsibility, where both parties are responsible for protecting each other against claims. The wording is kept professional and the meaning has been shifted subtly to present a more collaborative indemnification obligation between the two parties.

original: 12.1.  By EFS . EFS shall indemnify, defend and hold Client, its parent,  subsidiaries and affiliates and the directors, officers, shareholders, employees  and agents of each harmless against any claims, suits, losses, liabilities,  injuries or damages (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys ’ fees and litigation expenses) arising out of any third party claim relating to (a) the Playboy Commerce Business, including, the marketing and operation thereof;  (b) the Privacy Policy; (c) EFS ’ use of any Client Property not permitted by or  inconsistent with this Agreement; (d) any claims brought by users, service  providers or others in connection with this Agreement; (e) the User Data,  including the collection, storage and/or use thereof; (f) any alleged action or failure to act whatsoever in regard to EFS ’ performance of its obligations and  duties under this Agreement; (g) the EFS Sites, including, but not limited to,  the operation of the EFS Sites and content contained thereon; (h) any breach by  EFS of any of its representations and warranties set forth above; (i) the sale  or availability through the Catalogs and/or Websites of any content and/or  Merchandise, which includes any performer who was less than eighteen (18) years  of age at the time of production; (j) any EFS Produced Merchandise; (k) any  alleged non -conformity to or non -compliance with any Law, including, but not  limited to, pertaining to the content, design or quality of any portion of the  Playboy Commerce Business; or (l) any claim or allegation by a third party  claiming rights (including, but not limited to, any copyright, trademark or  patent rights) in or to EFS Property, the Derivative Works (to the extent caused  by EFS), the Merchandise available for sale via the Playboy Commerce Business or  the operation of the Playboy Commerce Business.

13. Limitation of  Liability . EXCEPT IN THE EVENT OF A BREACH OF SECTION 8  (CONFIDENTIALITY) OR LIABILITY ARISING UNDER A PARTY ’S INDEMNIFICATION  OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 12, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR ANY  INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF  OR IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY MATTER RELATED HERETO,  INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOST BUSINESS OR LOST PROFITS, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY  HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
ollama_generated: 13. Limitation of Liability . Except in cases where a breach of Section 8 (Confidentiality) has occurred or liability arises from a party's indemnification obligations under Section 12, it is specifically agreed that neither party will be held responsible for any direct damages, losses, or expenses incurred as a result of this Agreement or any matter related thereto. However, this limitation does not apply to either party in the event that such damages, losses, or expenses were intentionally caused by one party with knowledge of their harmful nature and effect. Furthermore, each party acknowledges and accepts the risk of potential indirect, special, incidental, punitive, or consequential damages, including but not limited to lost business or lost profits, even if advised of such possibilities.

original: provided, however, that as soon as reasonably practicable prior to any such  circumstance, and in any event promptly thereafter, the affected party (a) has  so notified the other in writing; (b) takes reasonable measures to avoid or  limit the effect or duration of such circumstances; and (c) cooperates with the  other party to reasonably alter its obligations hereunder and/or resume performance under this Agreement as soon as reasonably  practicable.  If any such circumstance persists for longer than ninety  (90) days, Client may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice  without penalty.
ollama_generated: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, in the event that either party encounters unforeseen circumstances, it shall be required to: (a) promptly notify the other in writing; (b) strive to alleviate or mitigate the impact of such circumstances as expeditiously as feasible; and (c) collaborate with the other party to modify their obligations under this Agreement as necessary. If such circumstances continue for a period exceeding ninety (90) days without resolution, the notified party reserves the right to terminate this Agreement immediately, effective upon written notice, without incurring any penalties or liabilities beyond those already accrued up until the time of termination.

Addressee: Kurt D. Olender, Esq., OlenderFeldman, LLP, 2840 Morris Avenue, Union, NJ 07083

Altered Clause:
In the event that any disputes or claims arise between the parties under this agreement, it shall be the responsibility of the claimant to first engage in good faith negotiations with the other party for a period of sixty (60) days prior to initiating any legal action. If the parties fail to resolve their dispute during this negotiation period, then and only then may either party pursue legal remedies, subject to the jurisdiction of the courts of Union County, New Jersey.

original: (b) Substantially  all expedited (next day and 2 -day delivery) orders, regardless of channel,  received in time for the Monday through Friday 2:00 PM ET cutoff will be picked,  packed and shipped that same day.  Exceptions: Credit card  irregularities, which cannot be resolved same day, will ship the following  Business Day with notification to the customer.  In the event of  system problems that prevent turnover to shipper by last pickup, customers will  be notified and packages will be shipped expedited the next Business  Day.
ollama_generated: (b) While we strive for efficiency, not all expedited orders may be fulfilled on the same day, especially if they are received after our 2:00 PM ET cutoff on Monday through Friday. However, we will make every effort to process and dispatch these orders within one business day. Exceptions include credit card irregularities, which might delay shipping until the following business day, with proper notification to the customer. In cases where system problems prevent timely pickup by our courier, we will promptly notify affected customers and expedite shipping for their packages on the next business day. We appreciate your understanding and patience in these rare instances.

original: (c) Substantially  all customer returns will be processed within two (2) Business Days of dock  receipt.
ollama_generated: (c) Customer returns may be processed within a period of up to four (4) Business Days following the dock receipt, subject to exceptional circumstances that could reasonably delay the processing timeframe. The Service Provider shall make reasonable efforts to process returns promptly and keep the Client informed of any delays.

original: 2. To ensure that EFS Produced Merchandise and the Materials are constantly  maintained in conformance with the previously approved samples pursuant to  Section 1 of this Exhibit 9 above, EFS shall, within ten (10) days of  receipt of a request from Client, send or cause to be sent to Client at  EFS’ expense:  (i) such actual samples requested by Client of  the EFS Produced Merchandise and the Materials EFS is using,  manufacturing, selling, distributing or otherwise disposing of; and (ii) a  listing or revised listing of each location where any of the EFS Produced  Merchandise and the Materials or either thereof are designed, manufactured, stored or otherwise dealt with, except to the extent such  listing or revised listing duplicates currently accurate information  previously provided. 2. To allow flexibility in the maintenance of EFS Produced Merchandise and Materials, deviations from previously approved samples under Section 1 of this Exhibit 9 may occur at any time without prior notice to the Client. However, upon the Client's reasonable request within ten (10) days, EFS shall, at its discretion and expense, provide the Client with:

   (i) Representative samples of the EFS Produced Merchandise and Materials currently in use or production;
   (ii) A general overview of locations where any of the EFS Produced Merchandise and Materials are primarily handled, except where such information has been previously disclosed.

The Client, its nominees, employees, agents, and representatives retain the right to request entry and inspect, during regular business hours, any relevant location(s) at their discretion. They may also take individual samples of the EFS Produced Merchandise and Materials for quality assurance purposes, with prior notice to and at the expense of EFS.
